title: Sunita Williams "Could Have Returned" On Starliner. Why She Didn't
content: A US astronaut stuck on the International Space Station said Friday he believed Boeing's Starliner could have carried him home if more time had been available to work through the beleaguered spacecraft's issues.
summary: A US astronaut stuck on the International Space Station said Friday he believed Boeing's Starliner could have carried him home if more time had been available to work through the beleaguered spacecraft's issues.

title: Kamala Harris Says She Will Cut Degree Requirements For Certain Federal Job
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris said on Friday she will cut college degree requirements for certain federal jobs if elected president after the Nov. 5 elections in which she faces Republican former President Donald Trump.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris said on Friday she will cut college degree requirements for certain federal jobs if elected president after the Nov. 5 elections in which she faces Republican former President Donald Trump.

title: What We Know About US Vice President Kamala Harris' Gun
content: Democrat Vice President Kamala Harris said during Tuesday's debate with Republican Donald Trump that she owns a gun, a revelation that surprised some voters but carried a deliberate political message.
summary: Democrat Vice President Kamala Harris said during Tuesday's debate with Republican Donald Trump that she owns a gun, a revelation that surprised some voters but carried a deliberate political message.

title: Brazil Judge Seizes $3 Million From Elon Musk To Pay X Fines
content: Brazil's Supreme Court said Friday that a judge has ordered the transfer of some $3 million from Elon Musk's companies to pay fines incurred by his social network X, which has been suspended in the country.
summary: Brazil's Supreme Court said Friday that a judge has ordered the transfer of some $3 million from Elon Musk's companies to pay fines incurred by his social network X, which has been suspended in the country.

title: Trump And Kamala Harris Are "Against Life", Says Pope Francis
content: Pope Francis said that both sending migrants away and not giving migrants the ability to work or welcoming them is a sin.
summary: Pope Francis said that both sending migrants away and not giving migrants the ability to work or welcoming them is a sin.

title: Trump, Kamala Harris Campaign In Battlegrounds As Migrant Row Intensifies
content: US presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris again took their campaigns to battleground states Friday as a racially charged row over Haitian immigrants intensified with the Republican leader promising "large deportations."
summary: US presidential candidates Donald Trump and Kamala Harris again took their campaigns to battleground states Friday as a racially charged row over Haitian immigrants intensified with the Republican leader promising "large deportations."

title: Trump Says Would Order "Large Deportations" From Ohio Amid Migrant Row
content: Donald Trump said Friday that if elected president again he would initiate "large deportations" from the Ohio city that has seen a recent influx of Haitian migrants, whom he has baselessly accused of eating cats and dogs.
summary: Donald Trump said Friday that if elected president again he would initiate "large deportations" from the Ohio city that has seen a recent influx of Haitian migrants, whom he has baselessly accused of eating cats and dogs.

title: Who Is The Lesser Evil? Pope Slams Both Kamala Harris, Trump Ahead Of Polls
content: Pope Francis on Friday criticized both former U.S. President Donald Trump over his plan to deport millions of immigrants and Vice President Kamala Harris over her stance supporting abortion rights.
summary: Pope Francis on Friday criticized both former U.S. President Donald Trump over his plan to deport millions of immigrants and Vice President Kamala Harris over her stance supporting abortion rights.

title: Man Sues Realtors After Finding Jeff Bezos Bought His Home For Less Price
content: A Brazilian businessman, Leo Kryss, has filed a lawsuit against realtor Douglas Elliman, alleging he was misled into selling his Miami Beach mansion for $6 million less to Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.
summary: A Brazilian businessman, Leo Kryss, has filed a lawsuit against realtor Douglas Elliman, alleging he was misled into selling his Miami Beach mansion for $6 million less to Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.

title: 49 Ukrainian Prisoners Of War Return From Russia: Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced Friday that 49 Ukrainian POWs had been returned from Russia, with news agency AFP witnessing the group being greeted at the border with Belarus.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced Friday that 49 Ukrainian POWs had been returned from Russia, with news agency AFP witnessing the group being greeted at the border with Belarus.

title: Brazil Court Lifts Starlink, X Account Blockage After $3 Million Transfer
content: Brazil's Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes decided to lift blockages previously imposed on Starlink and X accounts after ordering the transfer of 18.35 million reais ($3.31 million) from the accounts to the country's national coffers.
summary: Brazil's Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes decided to lift blockages previously imposed on Starlink and X accounts after ordering the transfer of 18.35 million reais ($3.31 million) from the accounts to the country's national coffers.

title: Justin Timberlake Given Community Service In Drunk Driving Case: Report
content: Pop star Justin Timberlake was handed a sentence of community service on Friday after he changed his plea to guilty following his arrest for drunk driving, US media reported.
summary: Pop star Justin Timberlake was handed a sentence of community service on Friday after he changed his plea to guilty following his arrest for drunk driving, US media reported.

title: Alleged Mexican Drug Lord Pleads Not Guilty To Drug Trafficking Charges
content: The co-founder of the deadly Mexican Sinaloa cartel, Ismael Zambada, appeared in court in Brooklyn Friday, pleading not guilty to a raft of charges following his arrest in a dramatic sting by US agents.
summary: The co-founder of the deadly Mexican Sinaloa cartel, Ismael Zambada, appeared in court in Brooklyn Friday, pleading not guilty to a raft of charges following his arrest in a dramatic sting by US agents.

title: 3 US Citizens Sentenced To Death In Congo Over Role In Failed Coup
content: Three U.S. citizens on trial for their role in a failed coup in Democratic Republic of Congo were sentenced to death by a military court on Friday.
summary: Three U.S. citizens on trial for their role in a failed coup in Democratic Republic of Congo were sentenced to death by a military court on Friday.

title: Breakthrough mRNA Cancer Vaccine Shows Early Promise In Clinical Trials
content: Modernas new cancer vaccine, mRNA-4359, shows promising results in early clinical trials. Utilizing mRNA technology, similar to its Covid-19 vaccine, this treatment primes the immune system to identify and destroy cancer cells.
summary: Modernas new cancer vaccine, mRNA-4359, shows promising results in early clinical trials. Utilizing mRNA technology, similar to its Covid-19 vaccine, this treatment primes the immune system to identify and destroy cancer cells.

title: Russia Making New Kamikaze Drone With Chinese Engine, US Voices Concern
content: Russia started producing a new long-range attack drone called the Garpiya-A1 last year using Chinese engines and parts, which it deployed in the Ukraine war, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents seen by Reuters.
summary: Russia started producing a new long-range attack drone called the Garpiya-A1 last year using Chinese engines and parts, which it deployed in the Ukraine war, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents seen by Reuters.

title: As Maldives Faces Debt Default, China Inks New Finance Pact. Details Here
content: China and Maldives have signed a new agreement today that allows Beijing to lend more financial support to the already debt-distressed nation. China's central bank has said the pact will also help strengthen trade and investment.
summary: China and Maldives have signed a new agreement today that allows Beijing to lend more financial support to the already debt-distressed nation. China's central bank has said the pact will also help strengthen trade and investment.

title: 7 Men Jailed In UK's Largest Child Abuse Probe For Decades-Old Crimes
content: Seven men who sexually abused two girls two decades ago received hefty jail sentences in the UK on Friday as a result of Britain's biggest ever investigation into child abuse.
summary: Seven men who sexually abused two girls two decades ago received hefty jail sentences in the UK on Friday as a result of Britain's biggest ever investigation into child abuse.

title: Morocco Records First Mpox Case In Marrakesh Since WHO Emergency Alert
content: Morocco has recorded a case of mpox in the tourist city of Marrakesh, the first in north Africa since the WHO declared an international emergency last month, the Africa CDC said.
summary: Morocco has recorded a case of mpox in the tourist city of Marrakesh, the first in north Africa since the WHO declared an international emergency last month, the Africa CDC said.

title: Nearly 250,000 Displaced In Myanmar After Typhoon Yagi Floods: Report
content: Floods in Myanmar sparked by Typhoon Yagi have displaced more than 235,000 people and killed at least 33, the junta said on Friday.
summary: Floods in Myanmar sparked by Typhoon Yagi have displaced more than 235,000 people and killed at least 33, the junta said on Friday.
